answer: <p>It means you are testing, evaluating, or printing a variable that you have not yet assigned anything to.  It means you either have a typo, or you need to check that the variable was initialized to something first.  Check your logic paths, it may be set in one path but not in another.</p>

<p>Probably you were using an old PHP version until and now upgraded PHP thats the reason it was working without any error till now from years.</p>
<p>Until PHP 4 there was no error if you are using variable without defining it but as of PHP&nbsp;5 onwards it throws errors for codes like mentioned in question.</p>
